metadata.title: CVE-2018-19217 on Ubuntu 21.10 (impish) - low.
metadata.description:
** DISPUTED ** In ncurses, possibly a 6.x version, there is a NULL pointer dereference at the function _nc_name_match that will lead to a denial of service attack. NOTE: the original report stated version 6.1, but the issue did not reproduce for that version according to the maintainer or a reliable third-party.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo ua fix CVE-2018-19217` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

lib32ncurses6 - 6.2+20201114-2build1
lib32ncursesw6 - 6.2+20201114-2build1
lib32tinfo6 - 6.2+20201114-2build1
lib64ncurses6 - 6.2+20201114-2build1
lib64ncursesw6 - 6.2+20201114-2build1
lib64tinfo6 - 6.2+20201114-2build1
libncurses5 - 6.2+20201114-2build1
libncurses6 - 6.2+20201114-2build1
libncursesw5 - 6.2+20201114-2build1
libncursesw6 - 6.2+20201114-2build1
libtinfo5 - 6.2+20201114-2build1
libtinfo6 - 6.2+20201114-2build1
ncurses-base - 6.2+20201114-2build1
ncurses-bin - 6.2+20201114-2build1
ncurses-examples - 6.2+20201114-2build1
ncurses-term - 6.2+20201114-2build1
No subscription required

notes.note: ccdm94> for xenial and trusty the issue reproduces for the release version of the package with the provided POC file. However, patches applied to fix the CVE group CVE-2017-137xx and the CVE group CVE-2017-1068x have most likely fixed the currently considered vulnerability as well, with the reproducer no longer causing a segmentation fault for versions of the package that include these patches. This means that within the fixes present in the already applied patches was the fix for this CVE as well.

criterions.comment: ncurses package in impish, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '6.2+20201114-2build1').
